answers.answer: What amount has your vet prescribed?  Is your dog showing ill effects from this dosage?  You should only be giving your dog a medication that has been prescribed by his or her vet, so if you are worried that this is too large a dose or if your dog is showing adverse signs from the medication you need to contact your veterinarian IMMEDIATELY and tell them what is happening. Especially with diabetes your dog's life depends on this.  Please don't guess, call the vet ASAP.Ghilly

question: I am giving my dog 100 units/ml+ 10ml of novolin she is 10 pounds is that to much?
title: diebetic
